humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the larger focus of the invasive ductal carcinoma as 1.1 cm, which is less than the 2 cm threshold for T2 tumors. As tumor size is used to determine the T stage, regardless of the type of carcinoma, and the presence of ductal carcinoma in situ or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage, the T stage for this patient is T1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is based on the size of the tumor. According to the report, the larger focus of the tumor is 1.1 cm in size. The T stage categories are as follows: T1 (tumor is 2 cm or less in size), T2 (tumor is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in size), T3 (tumor is more than 5 cm in size), and T4 (tumor of any size that extends through the chest wall or skin). Based on the size of the larger focus of the tumor (1.1 cm), the T stage for this patient is T2.
